Subject: RE: [junit] Need example JUnit tests to validate Test Mentor's support of JUnit
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
In-Reply-To: <NDBBJEFKMDGFIBEKKELEAEANDDAA.msilverstein@...>
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
From: Hugo Garcia <elhugonyc@...>


Would it be possible to integrate this tool with Ant?

-H

--- Michael Silverstein <msilverstein@...> wrote:
> It depends. The tests are stand-alone Java classes, so you can execute them
> as part of your build. If you want the code coverage, the JPDA setup is
> currently managed from the GUI, but I'm sure we could make it command-line
> driven if somebody asked for it. The test generation (generate tests from
> Rose design models, or class relationships) part is also driven from a GUI.
> We are demand driven and very open to input, so if users indicated it would
> be helpful for various aspects to be controlled from the command line we are
> certainly open to adding that ability.
> 
> 
> 
> ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

> 
>   Michael Silverstein wrote:
>   >I threw together a screen capture to illustrate at:
>   >http://www.silvermark.com/evaluators/5.3result_junit.html
> 
>   Is there a command line version, or an interactive API?
> 
>   I would probably want to integrate this tool into the build process, so I
> need a way to automate the testing and results. That way I can become a
> build nazi, and notify the offending programmer every time he/she checks in
> code that is not tested.
> 
>
